verses.roman:
nirbhinnāny asya carmāṇi
loka-pālo 'nilo 'viśat
prāṇenāṁśena saṁsparśaṁ
yenāsau pratipadyate

synonyms: nirbhinnāni—being separated; asya—of the gigantic form; carmāṇi—skin; loka-pālaḥ—the director; anilaḥ—air; aviśat—entered; prāṇena aṁśena—the part of the breathing; saṁsparśam—touch; yena—by which; asau—the living entity; pratipadyate—can experience.
translation: When there was a manifestation of skin separated from the gigantic form, Anila, the deity directing the wind, entered with partial touch, and thus the living entities can realize tactile knowledge.
